xxl.io
Class LRUBuffer.Slot

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.io.Buffer.Slot
        |
        +--xxl.io.LRUBuffer.Slot
Enclosing class:
LRUBuffer
protected class LRUBuffer.Slot
extends Buffer.Slot

This class provides a single slot in a LRU buffer.

Every slot is linked to its predecessor and successor in the double linked list representing the duration of being unfixed. When a slot is fixed, it is not contained in the list and its predecessor and successor are set to null. In addition to the usual methods of a slot, slots of LRU buffers support the removal out of the double linked list by the unlink method. When fixing a slot, it is removed out of the list and it is appended in front of the list, when it is unfixed.

Field Detail

prev

protected LRUBuffer.Slot prev
The predecessor of this slot in the double linked list representing the duration of being unfixed. When this slot is not contained by the list or the first element of it, the predecessor is set to null.

next

protected LRUBuffer.Slot next
The successor of this slot in the double linked list representing the duration of being unfixed. When this slot is not contained by the list or the last element of it, the successor is set to null.
Constructor Detail

LRUBuffer.Slot

public LRUBuffer.Slot(int index)
Constructs a new empty slot with the specified index. The new slot contains no object, is not fixed and has no predecessor and successor.
Parameters:
index - the index of the new slot.
Method Detail

unlink

protected void unlink()
Removes this slot out of the double linked list representing duration of being unfixed.

fix

public void fix()
Fixes this slot so that the object contained by it cannot be removed out of the LRU buffer. This implementation also removes the slot out of the double linked list.
Overrides:
fix in class Buffer.Slot

unfix

public void unfix()
Unfixes this slot so that the object contained by it can be removed out of the buffer. This implementation also appends the slot in front of the double linked list.
Overrides:
unfix in class Buffer.Slot

remove

public void remove()
Removes the object and any information belonging to it from this slot so that it is empty thereafter. This implementation also removes the slot out of the double linked list.
Overrides:
remove in class Buffer.Slot
